feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Central Interior and Eastern Alaska Range Thursday night into Friday... A weather front is expected to move over the Interior from the south Thursday night into Friday spreading snow across the area. There is still low confidence with the timing and duration of the snowfall as the front could linger over the area into Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO NOON AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations around 6 inches. South wind gusts to 25 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range, Trims Camp and south. * WHEN...From noon Thursday to noon AKDT Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN EXPECTED THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... A FRONT OVER THE EASTERN GULF OF ALASKA WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH N THROUGH THIS EVENING. A SECOND FRONT WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE WILL MERGE WITH THE FIRST FRONT OVER THE NE GULF COAST LATE TONIGHT THEN SPREAD EASTWARD THURSDAY. HEAVIEST RAINFALL RATES OVER THE NE GULF COAST EXPECTED THURSDAY WITH AMOUNTS OF 2-3" EXPECTED. THIS WILL
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Thursday into Saturday Morning... Elevated surf is expected to develop along the coast near the Yukon Delta and St Lawrence Island. North to northeasterly winds will increase Thursday morning to 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for north facing coastal areas of St Lawrence Island and the Yukon Delta. Winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 04 at 9:53AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall over and upstream from Astor combined with breezy northeast winds have brought the Saint Johns River at Astor into Moderate Flood. River levels are forecast to remain in Moderate Flood between 3.0 and 3.1 feet through the weekend.

For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 04 at 1:06PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Texas, including the following counties, in north central Texas, Fannin and Hunt. In northeast Texas, Delta, Hopkins, Lamar and Rains.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued October 04 at 7:37AM CDT until October 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding
